dublin_core.dcvalue: In this paper a novel medical data compression algorithm termed layered set partitioning in hierarchical trees LSPIHT algorithm is presented for telemedicine applications In the LSPIHT the encoded bit streams are divided into a number of layers for transmission and reconstruction Starting from the base layer by accumulating bit streams up to different enhancement layers we can reconstruct medical data with various signal to noise ratios SNRs and or resolutions Receivers with distinct specifications can then share the same source encoder to reduce the complexity of telecommunication networks for telemedicine applications Numerical results show that besides having low network complexity the LSPIHT attains better rate distortion performance as compared with other algorithms for encoding medical data
